result.execSummary:
The defendant Dario Rizo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 277 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with victims or their residence.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

AMENDED ON 5/26/2017:  "Pursuant to the Victim's Accounting of Liquidated Restitution dated September 28, 2016, the defendants have paid $153,946.63 towards the restitution owed."

CORRECTED ON 2/08/16: $629.11 to be added to make the new total $397,958.49 (this is paid to J. Gunderson) jointly and severally w/co-defendants


CORRECTED ON 2/08/16: $629.11 to be added to make the new total $397,958.49 (this is paid to J. Gunderson) jointly and severally w/co-defendants

AS OF 2/03/2016: RESTITUTION WAS ADDED IN THE AMOUNT OF $397,329.38 (jointly and severally w/co-defendants) As follows: $388,000.00 - to Ms. A. Gunderson, $47.68 for doctor visits, $4,901.75 for lost wages, $679.47 for the Safe, $150.00 for a sweater and 2 blankets, $435.14 for Gun fees and permit, and $3,115.34 for Alarm system. 
25% to come out of prison wages to be applied to Restitution,  not any monies deposited from the outside of the prison. Balance to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. Civil Judgment to be taken if not paid.

Defendant Dario Rizo in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Steven Biskupic on behalf of the victim.  Parties stipulate to the restitution amount of $629.11 owed to Mr. Gunderson. Court grants and orders that amount jointly and severally.  Antoinette Gunderson was sworn and testified. Cross examination by the defense. Jeffrey Gunderson was sworn and testified. Cross examination by the defense.  Detective Stephen Westphal was sworn and testified. Cross examination by the defense.  Court orders restitution jointly and severally regarding Ms. Gunderson in the amount of $388,000.00 plus
$47.68 doctor visits
$4901.75 lost wages
$679.47 for the safe
$150.00 for a sweater and 2 blankets
$435.14 gun fees and permit
$3115.34 Alarm System
TOTAL $397,329.38
FRUTHER ORDERED court does sign the orders regarding the Quick Claim Deed regarding the homes and order regarding the vehicle and copies of said orders provided to Attorney Biskupic. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that any restitution paid, only 25% be taken out of their prison pay, not any monies deposited from the outside of prison.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dario Rizo in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing.  Victim presents statements to the court. State presents statements and is requesting a prison sentence be imposed. Attorney Wolff presents statements to the court. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

7 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 277 days)
  -  3 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  4 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  victims or their residence
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 
RESTITUTION:   To be determined

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

  Restitution hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
